summary.body: Could anyone recommend a good broadband deal and service. I'm with Tiscali and the service has been getting worse and worse recently and they can't offer 8mb in the area. Also now that they are all offering phone packages as well it is getting very confusing. I'm split between BT, Sky and Bulldog at the moment.
summary.subject: Broadband

summary.body: Has anybody used Abracadabra or Helping Hands for cleaning (or anything else)? If so, a report would be most welcome. Thanks
summary.subject: cleaner report

summary.body: Has anybody tried to buy anything from Ikea and have it delivered by them to the Barbican? I have been informed by Customer SErvices that I cannot go to Edmonton to buy my stuff and then have it delivered to EC2, but have to go to CROYDON in order to do this! What tosh! And I cannot order over the phone either! Any suggestions? Like go to John Lewis?
summary.subject: Ikea deliveries

summary.body: Thinking of calling Abracadabra to do a professional clean to my new Barbican flat.  Can any of you recommend them?
summary.subject: Flat cleaning

summary.body: Our ISP (beeb.net) is terminating its services at the end of June, so we have to find a new service provider. We thought we should update our communications generally at the same time - we dont like BT, and we havent got wireless (though we arent sure we need it  we certainly dont need internet access on the move.) Has anyone any advice on this, particularly on service providers?  Beeb.net charges us 25 a month for broadband access (there are no call charges). Were looking for a provider which can give us at least 2 different email addresses, with the option in the future of hosting a modest business website. We use the internet several times a day, but dont download films and other big items. We dont make many phone calls, so our BT line rental accounts for most of the phone bill - there may be a more efficient way of dealing with this. Ive looked at the websites of the ISPs recommended here, but their range of options is pretty bewildering if you arent up to date with technology. Needless to say we want an ISP with a decent level of technical support.   A big thank you to anyone who can advise!
summary.subject: Phone and internet providers - recommendations?

summary.body: Holmes Place Barbican has been trying to put my Gold/Link membership up to 980 per year on the basis that that is their usual membership.  I've resisted and they have now come in with a better offer but I'd be grateful to hear from others about what they pay, particularly if there is anyone with an ancient membership which was supposed to give a permanent discount. Also, since Holmes Place often raises my blood pressure as much as it's supposed to lower it, does anyone have strong recommendations for alternatives.  Is Champneys still hugely expensive?
summary.subject: Gym fees

summary.body: Does anyone know the name of the company at 48 Chiswell Street, at the bottom of Whitecross Street? Their staff have been banned from smoking around the entrance to the building which means that all they do is cross over the road and smoke around the 02 entrance to Ben Jonson House instead, strewing the area with fag butts. It annoys me, probably more than it should I know...
summary.subject: 48 Chiswell Street

summary.body: Hi there,  Does anyone else in Lauderdale Tower in particular use Tiscali ? We are with them and although we pay for a 2Mb service, when I recently tested the line speed (see link below) I am getting speeds of 31.70 kpbs for example which means I might as well be dialling up and not paying for broadband !    I've spent many an afternoon on the phone to New Dehli to try and solve the problem and as such have : run anti spyware, switched off the firewall (temporarily of course), moved the wireless phone AND run a defrag ; and guess what - it's no faster. Is anyone else in a similar position or know what the issue might be ? ( I did read with interest the e-mails re broadband stats but am not sure if this is directly related ?). Any thoughts greatly appreciated ! Thanks, Liz
summary.subject: Broadband speed - Tiscali

summary.body: Has anyone registered for this service widely advertised by Carphone Warehouse or is actually using it? We should like to hear of your experience -upsides and downsides. And to hear of experience with other broadband providers before we desert snailband.
summary.subject: "Free broadband forever": Carphone Warehouse

summary.body: Hi all, Just moved into Defoe house and need the get an internet connection. I was hoping to get a 24mb one from Be Unlimited but they refuse to do it for my line, even though the say they cover the moorgate exchange. Does anyone else have an ADSL 2+ connection? Cheers! John
summary.subject: Broadband recommendations - anyone got ADSL 2+?

summary.body: I've just received the letter notifying of the price increase from EDF.  I've been labouring under the impression that in the Barbican we are "tied" to EDF and it isnt possible to change suppliers.  Ideally i'd like to use a green supplier of electricity, and to be able to shop around for a better deal. Can anyone advise on this?  Thanks
summary.subject: EDF Energy

summary.body: We have just received from EDF Energy the annual review of our monthly direct debit payment. At the end of the year we owed 25 and it was proposed to increase our monthly direct debit by 8 - 96 in the year to come. After a lengthy freephone call, this was reduced after much haggling to an additional 5 a month - 60 a year. EDF have been overestimating our direct debits in this manner for some years and I once raised the matter with Ofgen. We now contemplate looking for another supplier and will be interested in others' experience of EDF and any other suppliers and any suggestions for an alternative supplier and problems in switching suppliers. Help!  PS. We wish the French SNCF had taken over running our railways rather than dabbling in electricity supply.
summary.subject: Electricity charges

summary.body: It's been 10 days, 4 long phone calls, and BT still haven't allocated the right telephone number for our new home at Mount Joy. They have no record of the two order numbers being placed. Our calls are being routed through to call centres in India where they have been giving us wrong numbers and not placing the orders. Does anyone know of a currently good substitute for BT in the Barbican or is it a question of from the frying pan to the fire? Thanks everyone
summary.subject: B.T. Substitute?

summary.body: I'm a newcomer to TMH, and I've inherited a number of derelict planters. I'm no gardener. On consultation, the Estate Office who gave me a flyer for  Helping Hands Garden Services. Has anyone else used them please; if so, are they as helpful as their name suggests? If not, can anyone recommend a firm I can use. And is April a good month to replant? All advice welcomed. (My intention is to stick strictly to low maintenance planting.)
summary.subject: Advice re planters

summary.body: Hi Everyone  I'd like to watch the ashes but I need sky sports. How do people compare ntl (my flat has the wiring for this) to sky in terms of cost, ease of installation and time from initial order to completion? Thanks.
summary.subject: Easiest way to get Sky Sports

summary.body: We are considering 'migrating' as it is called from BT Broadband to Waitrose Broadband.  Since Moorgate (628) exchange moved from nearby to London Bridge area, we have experienced failed connections and more recently abysmally low download speeds (as I write it is 224 Kps as reported on ADSL router site); upload speed is fairly constant at normal 448Kps. Occasionally for only a short period upload is registered at about 5.5 Mps. Email to helpline reporting problems produced incomprehensible response and repeated requests for clarification have not been answered.  We wonder if others on BT Broadband on 628 exchange have had similar problems. We are in Brandon Mews. So a migration to Waitrose is on the cards and any comments on experience of migrating from BT and the quality of Waitrose Broadband will be welcome. Help!
summary.subject: Waitrose Broadband

summary.body: Has anyone tried the new Haidresser on Whitecross street? (opposite Waitrose)
summary.subject: Hairdresser

summary.body: Hi, can anyone recommend a good carpet cleaner please? I have a flyer for Martyn Everett (if you've used his services, let me know please if he was any good/ how much he charges!) but I usually like to get a couple of quotes. Any advice about carpet dry cleaning generally - it sounds better, but is it smelly?
summary.subject: Carpet cleaner rec please

summary.body: Has anybody used Steve Gregory for building work ? He has been recommended by the plumber who often does work in the Barbican. We have asked for references but I was also wondering whether other Barbican residents have used him.
summary.subject: reference for builder Steve Gregory

summary.body: All sorts of problems with the taps and original water heater in my kitchen. Is D J Welch still working on the estate? And are there any other recommended plumbers?
summary.subject: Any recommended plumbers?

summary.body: Can anyone recommend a supplier of contemporary fold-up wall beds for installation in a large studio?
summary.subject: Wall bed supplier?

summary.body: Has anyone used Quinn Interiors for blinds/reupholstering?  I need someone reliable and quick to respond for Tower Block flat.  Am looking for American type Silhouettes and darkening shades. Have used Denzils in years gone by, but would prefer someone else this time.
summary.subject: Curtain and Blind fitters

summary.body: I would like to switch from EDF to a 'greener' electricity supplier - could anyone recommend such an energy supplier who has experience of the Barbican (and the whereabouts of its meters) . Not quite ready to live off grid in a yurt yet but every little helps....
summary.subject: green electricity supplier ??

summary.body: Last year I used a decorator called Glen (don't know the surname) but I've since lost his phone number and would like to use him again. Does anyone know it?
summary.subject: PAINTER AND DECORATOR

summary.body: Hi, we have a one month old baby boy and were planning on using Sitters.co.uk for evening babysitting.  Apparently they have many clients in the area - does anyone have any experience using them and have any comments/ recommendations for particular sitters?
summary.subject: Babysitters

summary.body: Has anyone else attempted to get new TV sockets fitted by SCCI, and with any success? After 2 months we're still waiting just for them to give us a quote.  Tried chasing, they said the quote would go out urgently but still not a word.  I don't know why they wasted our time coming to measure up if they didn't want to do the work. Any advice about alternative contractors?
summary.subject: SCCI, new TV points

summary.body: Does anyone have any experience (either positive or negative) with John Roberts who is a fairly new plumber working on the estate?
summary.subject: Plumbers

summary.body: How much do local newsagents charge for delivering daily papers?
summary.subject: Home Newspaper Delivery

summary.body: Any idea what happened to Houseproud Cleaning Company and its owner Lisa?  They cleaned for me on a periodic basis for 10 years, the Barbican being our second home. She seems to have disappeared since the start of the year. I am not impressed by one of the local "big" cleaning companies (name on request) who just charged me 198 Pounds to clean 1100 sq. ft, then forgot to do the laundry as promised and subsequently sent me a bill for the congestion charge and parking (1 hr.) !!![size=18][/size]
summary.subject: Missing Cleaner?

summary.body: We've been using Helping Hand cleaners. Our current cleaner "Jola" is competent, and although I've some reservations about Helping Hand, they are by-and-large OK. Now I get a letter from Helping Hand saying they are closing down on Aug 31st and handing over "the network" to "Reme McGurn Trading as Sparkling Touch". I have to create a contract with her to continue the service we get. I am not atall sure about this. Has anyone any experience of "Reme McGurn trading as Sparkling Touch"? In particular, do they know the Barbican, provide photo id,show up on time  and clean the place OK?  Has anyone else had this letter from Helping Hand? Can anyone recommend another cleaning company/cleaner?
summary.subject: Helping Hand cleaner/Reme McGurn

summary.body: does anyone know of a company that deals specifically with replacing the ventilation pipes? i have recently had some very expensive kitchen replacement quotes and am realising it is cheaper to employ a carpenter, an electrician etc etc rather than have a company 'do it all' - but i am stuck on the ventilation pipe replacement - thanks for any suggestions
summary.subject: Kitchen Ventilation in Ben Jonson House

summary.body: I know this has been discussed before, but I can't find the info. Can anyone provide me with the details of the window box planting business, I think it was callled helping hands.... Ta Max
summary.subject: window box services
